Events.html: 1521 – Pope Leo X excommunicates Martin Luther in the papal bull Decet Romanum Pontificem.
Events.text: Pope Leo X excommunicates Martin Luther in the papal bull Decet Romanum Pontificem.

Events.html: 1653 – By the Coonan Cross Oath, the Eastern Church in India cuts itself off from colonial Portuguese tutelage.
Events.text: By the Coonan Cross Oath, the Eastern Church in India cuts itself off from colonial Portuguese tutelage.

Events.html: 1749 – Benning Wentworth issues the first of the New Hampshire Grants, leading to the establishment of Vermont.
Events.text: Benning Wentworth issues the first of the New Hampshire Grants, leading to the establishment of Vermont.

Events.html: 1749 – The first issue of Berlingske, Denmark's oldest continually operating newspaper, is published.
Events.text: The first issue of Berlingske, Denmark's oldest continually operating newspaper, is published.

Events.html: 1777 – American General George Washington defeats British General Lord Cornwallis at the Battle of Princeton.
Events.text: American General George Washington defeats British General Lord Cornwallis at the Battle of Princeton.

Events.html: 1815 – Austria, the United Kingdom, and France form a secret defensive alliance against Prussia and Russia.
Events.text: Austria, the United Kingdom, and France form a secret defensive alliance against Prussia and Russia.

Events.html: 1823 – Stephen F. Austin receives a grant of land in Texas from the government of Mexico.
Events.text: Stephen F. Austin receives a grant of land in Texas from the government of Mexico.

Events.html: 1848 – Joseph Jenkins Roberts is sworn in as the first president of the independent African Liberia.
Events.text: Joseph Jenkins Roberts is sworn in as the first president of the independent African Liberia.

Events.html: 1861 – American Civil War: Delaware votes not to secede from the United States.
Events.text: American Civil War: Delaware votes not to secede from the United States.

Events.html: 1868 – Meiji Restoration in Japan: The Tokugawa shogunate is abolished; agents of Satsuma and Chōshū seize power.
Events.text: Meiji Restoration in Japan: The Tokugawa shogunate is abolished; agents of Satsuma and Chōshū seize power.

Events.html: 1870 – Construction of the Brooklyn Bridge begins.
Events.text: Construction of the Brooklyn Bridge begins.

Events.html: 1885 – Sino-French War: Beginning of the Battle of Núi Bop
Events.text: Sino-French War: Beginning of the Battle of Núi Bop

Events.html: 1888 – The refracting telescope at the Lick Observatory, measuring 91 cm in diameter, is used for the first time. It was the largest telescope in the world at the time.
Events.text: The refracting telescope at the Lick Observatory, measuring 91 cm in diameter, is used for the first time. It was the largest telescope in the world at the time.

Events.html: 1911 – A magnitude 7.7 earthquake destroys the city of Almaty in Russian Turkestan.
Events.text: A magnitude 7.7 earthquake destroys the city of Almaty in Russian Turkestan.

Events.html: 1919 – At the Paris Peace Conference, Emir Faisal I of Iraq signs an agreement with Zionist leader Chaim Weizmann on the development of a Jewish homeland in Palestine and an Arab nation in a large part of the Middle East.
Events.text: At the Paris Peace Conference, Emir Faisal I of Iraq signs an agreement with Zionist leader Chaim Weizmann on the development of a Jewish homeland in Palestine and an Arab nation in a large part of the Middle East.

Events.html: 1925 – Benito Mussolini announces he is taking dictatorial powers over Italy.
Events.text: Benito Mussolini announces he is taking dictatorial powers over Italy.

Events.html: 1932 – Martial law is declared in Honduras to stop a revolt by banana workers fired by the United Fruit Company.
Events.text: Martial law is declared in Honduras to stop a revolt by banana workers fired by the United Fruit Company.

Events.html: 1933 – Minnie D. Craig becomes the first female elected as Speaker of the North Dakota House of Representatives, the first female to hold a Speaker position anywhere in the United States.
Events.text: Minnie D. Craig becomes the first female elected as Speaker of the North Dakota House of Representatives, the first female to hold a Speaker position anywhere in the United States.

links.subject: Speaker of the North Dakota House of Representatives
links.title: Speaker of the North Dakota House of Representatives

Events.html: 1938 – The March of Dimes is established by President Franklin D. Roosevelt.
Events.text: The March of Dimes is established by President Franklin D. Roosevelt.

Events.html: 1944 – World War II: Top Ace Major Greg "Pappy" Boyington is shot down in his Vought F4U Corsair by Captain Masajiro Kawato flying a Mitsubishi A6M Zero.
Events.text: World War II: Top Ace Major Greg "Pappy" Boyington is shot down in his Vought F4U Corsair by Captain Masajiro Kawato flying a Mitsubishi A6M Zero.

links.subject: Masajiro Kawato
links.title: List of World War II aces from Japan

Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz is placed in command of all U.S. Naval forces in preparation for planned assaults against Iwo Jima and Okinawa in Japan.
Events.text: World War II: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz is placed in command of all U.S. Naval forces in preparation for planned assaults against Iwo Jima and Okinawa in Japan.

Events.html: 1946 – Popular Canadian American jockey George Woolf dies in a freak accident during a race; the annual George Woolf Memorial Jockey Award is created to honor him.
Events.text: Popular Canadian American jockey George Woolf dies in a freak accident during a race; the annual George Woolf Memorial Jockey Award is created to honor him.

Events.html: 1947 – Proceedings of the U.S. Congress are televised for the first time.
Events.text: Proceedings of the U.S. Congress are televised for the first time.

Events.html: 1949 – The Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas, the central bank of the Philippines, is established.
Events.text: The Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas, the central bank of the Philippines, is established.

Events.html: 1953 – Frances P. Bolton and her son, Oliver from Ohio, become the first mother and son to serve simultaneously in the U.S. Congress.
Events.text: Frances P. Bolton and her son, Oliver from Ohio, become the first mother and son to serve simultaneously in the U.S. Congress.

Events.html: 1956 – A fire damages the top part of the Eiffel Tower.
Events.text: A fire damages the top part of the Eiffel Tower.

Events.html: 1957 – The Hamilton Watch Company introduces the first electric watch.
Events.text: The Hamilton Watch Company introduces the first electric watch.

Events.html: 1958 – The West Indies Federation is formed.
Events.text: The West Indies Federation is formed.

Events.html: 1959 – Alaska is admitted as the 49th U.S. state.
Events.text: Alaska is admitted as the 49th U.S. state.

Events.html: 1959 – Separatists in the Maldives declare the establishment of the United Suvadive Republic.
Events.text: Separatists in the Maldives declare the establishment of the United Suvadive Republic.

Events.html: 1961 – The United States severs diplomatic relations with Cuba over the latter's nationalization of American assets.
Events.text: The United States severs diplomatic relations with Cuba over the latter's nationalization of American assets.

Events.html: 1961 – A core explosion and meltdown at the SL-1, a government-run reactor near Idaho Falls, Idaho, kills three workers.
Events.text: A core explosion and meltdown at the SL-1, a government-run reactor near Idaho Falls, Idaho, kills three workers.

Events.html: 1961 – In Finland's worst civilian aviation accident an Aero Flight 311 crashes near Kvevlax, resulting in the deaths of all 25 people aboard.
Events.text: In Finland's worst civilian aviation accident an Aero Flight 311 crashes near Kvevlax, resulting in the deaths of all 25 people aboard.

Events.html: 1962 – Pope John XXIII excommunicates Fidel Castro.
Events.text: Pope John XXIII excommunicates Fidel Castro.

Events.html: 1976 – The International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights comes into effect.
Events.text: The International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights comes into effect.

links.subject: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights
links.title: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights

Events.html: 1977 – Apple Computer is incorporated.
Events.text: Apple Computer is incorporated.

Events.html: 1990 – Former leader of Panama Manuel Noriega surrenders to American forces.
Events.text: Former leader of Panama Manuel Noriega surrenders to American forces.

Events.html: 1993 – In Moscow, Russia, George Bush and Boris Yeltsin sign the second Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty (START).
Events.text: In Moscow, Russia, George Bush and Boris Yeltsin sign the second Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty (START).

Events.html: 1994 – More than seven million people from the former apartheid Homelands receive South African citizenship.
Events.text: More than seven million people from the former apartheid Homelands receive South African citizenship.

Events.html: 1996 – The Motorola StarTAC, the first flip phone and one of the first mobile phones to gain widespread consumer adoption, goes on sale.
Events.text: The Motorola StarTAC, the first flip phone and one of the first mobile phones to gain widespread consumer adoption, goes on sale.

Events.html: 1997 – China announces it will spend US$27.7 billion to fight erosion and pollution in the Yangtze and Yellow River valleys.
Events.text: China announces it will spend US$27.7 billion to fight erosion and pollution in the Yangtze and Yellow River valleys.

Events.html: 1999 – The Mars Polar Lander is launched.
Events.text: The Mars Polar Lander is launched.

Events.html: 1999 – Israel detains, and later expels, 14 members of Concerned Christians.
Events.text: Israel detains, and later expels, 14 members of Concerned Christians.

Events.html: 2000 – The last original weekday Peanuts comic strip is published.
Events.text: The last original weekday Peanuts comic strip is published.

Events.html: 2002 – Israeli forces seize the Palestinian freighter Karine A in the Red Sea, finding 50 tons of weapons.
Events.text: Israeli forces seize the Palestinian freighter Karine A in the Red Sea, finding 50 tons of weapons.

Events.html: 2004 – Flash Airlines Flight 604 crashes into the Red Sea, resulting in 148 deaths, making it the deadliest aviation accident in Egyptian history.
Events.text: Flash Airlines Flight 604 crashes into the Red Sea, resulting in 148 deaths, making it the deadliest aviation accident in Egyptian history.

Events.html: 2009 – The first block of the blockchain of the decentralized payment system Bitcoin, called the Genesis block, was established by the creator of the system, Satoshi Nakamoto.
Events.text: The first block of the blockchain of the decentralized payment system Bitcoin, called the Genesis block, was established by the creator of the system, Satoshi Nakamoto.

Events.html: 2015 – Boko Haram militants raze the entire town of Baga in north-east Nigeria, with as many as 2,000 people having been killed.
Events.text: Boko Haram militants raze the entire town of Baga in north-east Nigeria, with as many as 2,000 people having been killed.
